message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.SY

The paper describes a novel approach to monitoring high-level behaviors of computer programs using concepts from AI planning. It specifically focuses on detecting malware by building an abstract model of the operating system using the STRIPS planning language and casting system calls as planning operators. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SE (Software Engineering) as the paper uses AI planning to detect malware and monitor program behavior. The paper also uses the STRIPS planning language, which falls under the cs.PL (Programming Languages) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the behavior of computer programs, which falls under the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category.
